trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with SAP HANA Cloud Platform | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with SAP HANA Cloud Platform | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use SAP HANA Cloud Platform with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use SAP HANA Cloud Platform with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and SAP HANA Cloud Platform.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and SAP HANA Cloud Platform.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A SAP HANA Cloud Platform account
trans-unit.target: A SAP HANA Cloud Platform account

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to SAP HANA Cloud Platform will be able to single sign into the application using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to SAP HANA Cloud Platform will be able to single sign into the application using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: You need to deploy your own application or subscribe to an application on your SAP HANA Cloud Platform account to test single sign on.
trans-unit.target: You need to deploy your own application or subscribe to an application on your SAP HANA Cloud Platform account to test single sign on.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, an application is deployed in the account.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, an application is deployed in the account.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for SAP HANA Cloud Platform
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for SAP HANA Cloud Platform

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Assigning a role to a user
trans-unit.target: Assigning a role to a user

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for SAP HANA Cloud Platform.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for SAP HANA Cloud Platform.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type SAP HANA Cloud Platform.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type SAP HANA Cloud Platform.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select SAP HANA Cloud Platform, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select SAP HANA Cloud Platform, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SAP Hana</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SAP Hana</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to SAP HANA Cloud Platform with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to SAP HANA Cloud Platform with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: As part of this procedure, you are required to upload a base-64 encoded certificate to your SAP HANA Cloud Platform tenant.
trans-unit.target: As part of this procedure, you are required to upload a base-64 encoded certificate to your SAP HANA Cloud Platform tenant.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the SAP HANA Cloud Platform application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the SAP HANA Cloud Platform application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to SAP HANA Cloud Platform page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to SAP HANA Cloud Platform page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, sign on to the SAP HANA Cloud Platform Cockpit at https://account.\.ondemand.com/cockpit (e.g.: https://account.hanatrial.ondemand.com/cockpit).
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, sign on to the SAP HANA Cloud Platform Cockpit at https://account.\.ondemand.com/cockpit (e.g.: https://account.hanatrial.ondemand.com/cockpit).

trans-unit.source: Click the Trust tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the Trust tab.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Trust</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Trust</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In trust management section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In trust management section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Get Metadata</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Get Metadata</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click the Local Service Provider tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the Local Service Provider tab.

trans-unit.source: To download the SAP HANA Cloud Platform metadata file, click Get Metadata.
trans-unit.target: To download the SAP HANA Cloud Platform metadata file, click Get Metadata.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Active Directory portal, on the Configure App URL page, perform the following steps, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Active Directory portal, on the Configure App URL page, perform the following steps, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Sign On URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign into your SAP HANA Cloud Platform application. This is the account-specific URL of a protected resource in your SAP HANA Cloud Platform application. The URL is based on the following pattern: https://\\.\.ondemand.com/\ (e.g.: https://xleavep1941203872trial.hanatrial.ondemand.com/xleave)
trans-unit.target: In the Sign On URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign into your SAP HANA Cloud Platform application. This is the account-specific URL of a protected resource in your SAP HANA Cloud Platform application. The URL is based on the following pattern: https://\\.\.ondemand.com/\ (e.g.: https://xleavep1941203872trial.hanatrial.ondemand.com/xleave)

trans-unit.source: This is the URL in your SAP HANA Cloud Platform application that requires the user to authenticate.
trans-unit.target: This is the URL in your SAP HANA Cloud Platform application that requires the user to authenticate.

trans-unit.source: Open the downloaded SAP HANA Cloud Platform metadata file, and then locate the ns3:AssertionConsumerService tag.
trans-unit.target: Open the downloaded SAP HANA Cloud Platform metadata file, and then locate the ns3:AssertionConsumerService tag.

trans-unit.source: Copy the value of the Location attribute, and then paste it into the SAP HANA Cloud Platform Reply URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: Copy the value of the Location attribute, and then paste it into the SAP HANA Cloud Platform Reply URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at SAP HANA Cloud Platform page, to download your metadata, click Download metadata, and then save the file on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at SAP HANA Cloud Platform page, to download your metadata, click Download metadata, and then save the file on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the SAP HANA Cloud Platform Cockpit, in the Local Service Provider section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the SAP HANA Cloud Platform Cockpit, in the Local Service Provider section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Trust Management</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Trust Management</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Edit.
trans-unit.target: Click Edit.

trans-unit.source: As Configuration Type, select Custom.
trans-unit.target: As Configuration Type, select Custom.

trans-unit.source: As Local Provider Name, leave the default value.
trans-unit.target: As Local Provider Name, leave the default value.

trans-unit.source: To generate a Signing Key and a Signing Certificate key pair, click Generate Key Pair.
trans-unit.target: To generate a Signing Key and a Signing Certificate key pair, click Generate Key Pair.

trans-unit.source: As Principal Propagation, select Disabled.
trans-unit.target: As Principal Propagation, select Disabled.

trans-unit.source: As Force Authentication, select Disabled.
trans-unit.target: As Force Authentication, select Disabled.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: Click the Trusted Identity Provider tab, and then click Add Trusted Identity Provider.
trans-unit.target: Click the Trusted Identity Provider tab, and then click Add Trusted Identity Provider.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Trust Management</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Trust Management</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To manage the list of trusted identity providers, you need to have chosen the Custom configuration type in the Local Service Provider section.
trans-unit.target: To manage the list of trusted identity providers, you need to have chosen the Custom configuration type in the Local Service Provider section.

trans-unit.source: For Default configuration type, you have a non-editable and implicit trust to the SAP ID Service.
trans-unit.target: For Default configuration type, you have a non-editable and implicit trust to the SAP ID Service.

trans-unit.source: For None, you don't have any trust settings.
trans-unit.target: For None, you don't have any trust settings.

trans-unit.source: Click the General tab, and then click Browse to upload the downloaded metadata file.
trans-unit.target: Click the General tab, and then click Browse to upload the downloaded metadata file.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Trust Management</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Trust Management</linkText>

trans-unit.source: After uploading the metadata file, the values for Single Sign-on URL, Single Logout URL and Signing Certificate are populated automatically.
trans-unit.target: After uploading the metadata file, the values for Single Sign-on URL, Single Logout URL and Signing Certificate are populated automatically.

trans-unit.source: Click the Attributes tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the Attributes tab.

trans-unit.source: On the Attributes tab, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Attributes tab, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Attributes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Attributes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: By clicking Add Assertion-Based Attribute, add the following assertion-based attributes:
trans-unit.target: By clicking Add Assertion-Based Attribute, add the following assertion-based attributes:

trans-unit.source: |Assertion Attribute| Principal Attribute| |-------------------|--------------------| |http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/givenname| firstname|--------------------|--------------------| |http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/surname| lastname|-----------| |http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/emailaddress|email|
trans-unit.target: |Assertion Attribute| Principal Attribute| |-------------------|--------------------| |http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/givenname| firstname|--------------------|--------------------| |http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/surname| lastname|-----------| |http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/emailaddress|email|

trans-unit.source: The configuration of the Attributes depends on how the application(s) on HCP are developed, i.e. which attribute(s) they expect in the SAML response and under which name (Principal Attribute) they access this attribute in the code.
trans-unit.target: The configuration of the Attributes depends on how the application(s) on HCP are developed, i.e. which attribute(s) they expect in the SAML response and under which name (Principal Attribute) they access this attribute in the code.

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: The Default Attribute in the screenshot is just for illustration purposes.
trans-unit.target: The Default Attribute in the screenshot is just for illustration purposes.

trans-unit.source: It is not required to make the scenario work.
trans-unit.target: It is not required to make the scenario work.

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: The names and values for Principal Attribute shown in the screenshot depend on how the application is developed.
trans-unit.target: The names and values for Principal Attribute shown in the screenshot depend on how the application is developed.

trans-unit.source: It is possible that your application requires different mappings.
trans-unit.target: It is possible that your application requires different mappings.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at SAP HANA Cloud Platform dialogue page, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at SAP HANA Cloud Platform dialogue page, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: As an optional step, you can configure assertion-based groups for your Azure Active Directory Identity Provider
trans-unit.target: As an optional step, you can configure assertion-based groups for your Azure Active Directory Identity Provider

trans-unit.source: Using groups on SAP HANA Cloud Platform allows you to dynamically assign one or more users to one or more roles in your SAP HANA Cloud Platform applications, determined by values of attributes in the SAML 2.0 assertion.
trans-unit.target: Using groups on SAP HANA Cloud Platform allows you to dynamically assign one or more users to one or more roles in your SAP HANA Cloud Platform applications, determined by values of attributes in the SAML 2.0 assertion.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the assertion contains the attribute "contract=temporary", you may want all affected users to be added to the group "TEMPORARY".
trans-unit.target: For example, if the assertion contains the attribute "contract=temporary", you may want all affected users to be added to the group "TEMPORARY".

trans-unit.source: The group "TEMPORARY" may contain one or more roles from one or more applications deployed in your SAP HANA Cloud Platform account.
trans-unit.target: The group "TEMPORARY" may contain one or more roles from one or more applications deployed in your SAP HANA Cloud Platform account.

trans-unit.source: Use assertion-based groups if you want to mass-assign many users to one or more roles of applications in your SAP HANA Cloud Platform account.
trans-unit.target: Use assertion-based groups if you want to mass-assign many users to one or more roles of applications in your SAP HANA Cloud Platform account.

trans-unit.source: If you only want to assign a single or small number of users to (a) specific role(s) we recommend assigning them directly in the “Authorizations” tab of the SAP HANA Cloud Platform cockpit.
trans-unit.target: If you only want to assign a single or small number of users to (a) specific role(s) we recommend assigning them directly in the “Authorizations” tab of the SAP HANA Cloud Platform cockpit.

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into SAP HANA Cloud Platform, you must assign roles in the SAP HANA Cloud Platform to them.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into SAP HANA Cloud Platform, you must assign roles in the SAP HANA Cloud Platform to them.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your SAP HANA Cloud Platform cockpit.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your SAP HANA Cloud Platform cockpit.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Authorizations</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Authorizations</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Authorization.
trans-unit.target: Click Authorization.

trans-unit.source: Click the Users tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the Users tab.

trans-unit.source: In the User textbox, type the user’s email address.
trans-unit.target: In the User textbox, type the user’s email address.

trans-unit.source: Click Assign to assign the user to a role.
trans-unit.target: Click Assign to assign the user to a role.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the SAP HANA Cloud Platform application integration page, click Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the SAP HANA Cloud Platform application integration page, click Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
